name: Risperidone Long-Acting Injection (Risperdal Consta)
summary: Risperidone LAI (Risperdal Consta) is a long-acting injectable atypical antipsychotic used in the maintenance treatment of schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
description: Risperidone LAI, marketed as Risperdal Consta, is an extended-release injectable formulation of the atypical antipsychotic risperidone. It is administered intramuscularly every two weeks to provide sustained symptom control in schizophrenia and as maintenance therapy in bipolar I disorder. The long-acting formulation improves adherence and stabilizes plasma concentrations compared to oral risperidone. It works by antagonizing dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2A receptors, helping reduce both positive and negative symptoms of psychosis.

off_label_uses: Severe behavioral disturbances in dementia (not recommended in elderly with dementia due to increased mortality risk)

items: Maintenance treatment of bipolar I disorder

sections.text: Risperidone LAI antagonizes dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2A receptors, reducing psychotic symptoms, mood instability, and aggression.

adult.schizophrenia: 25 mg intramuscularly every 2 weeks; may increase to 37.5â€“50 mg based on response and tolerability.
adult.bipolar_maintenance: 25 mg intramuscularly every 2 weeks; adjust based on clinical response.

items: Vial for intramuscular injection: 12.5 mg, 25 mg, 37.5 mg, 50 mg

sections.text: Therapeutic effect begins after 3 weeks; requires oral risperidone overlap for the first 3 weeks.

serious: increased risk of death in elderly with dementia-related psychosis

other: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis
May cause metabolic changes (weight gain, dyslipidemia, hyperglycemia)
Risk of tardive dyskinesia with long-term use

sections.pregnancy: Use only if potential benefit justifies risk; limited data
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; consider discontinuing nursing or the drug
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity; higher risk of stroke and death in dementia-related psychosis

sections.text: If discontinuation is necessary, taper gradually and switch to oral antipsychotic to avoid relapse.

items: Injection should be administered in the gluteal or deltoid muscle
Patients should continue oral risperidone for the first 3 weeks after starting
